There was no deviations from the intended intervention and appropriate analysis was done.only 1 patient in the favipiravir group stopped taking medicine due to headache. (1/54)

Analysis.name: Need for critical or intensive care (any reason)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Subjects were randomized based on a central, computer-generated randomization scheme co-ordinated by REDCap. Even though, the mortality is high in the favipiravir group, and patients with baseline cardiac diseases were high in the favi group, the authors have done a regression analysis to identify the association.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Only 2/250 in FVP group and 1/250 in the control group has undergone protocol deviation.ITT analysis was done
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: The knowledge of intervention do not affect the measurement of outcome :- Mortality.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Low risk
ClinicalTrials.gov (NCT04818320):- reported the previously mentioned results according to the SAP.

Analysis.name: Need for critical or intensive care (any reason)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Randomization was performed using a web-response system after stratification by COVID-19 severity.The patients were randomised in a ratio of 2:1. Percentage s similar, but p value is not calculated. allocation sequence random and probably concealed
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Some concerns

OPEN-LABEL STUDY

No mention of deviation from trial protocol.

No information on administration of co-interventions of interest: biologics, antivirals and corticosteroids; antivirals were part of standard of care, but no information is reported on who received these.
Hence, no information on whether deviations arose because of the trial context.

Statistical analysis was done on intended-to -treat populations which can be considered as an appropriate measure to detect the effect of interventions.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: 106/112 and 53/56 completed the study. data available for all randomised.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo:
Measured the number of patients requiring critical care within the study period.

Open-label study

The outcome cannot be influenced by the knowledge of intervention.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Low risk
data produced as a result of pre-specified analysis plan-NCT04501783, clinicaltrial.gov

Analysis.name: Need for admission to hospital (if ambulatory) – fixed-effect model
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Patients were randomized in a 1:1 ratio to oral favipiravir or placebo. The randomization schedule was generated using the PLAN Procedure (SAS) with a block size of four, stratified by study site. The generated list was embedded in the Research Electronic Data Capture (REDCap) system to ensure allocation concealment."
Allocation sequence random
Allocation sequence concealed
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk

“Participants, investigators, and study staff remained unaware of the treatment assignment. The Sponsor’s investigational drug unit, which is not part of the study team, held the information for treatment allocation.”
Blinded study (participants and personnel/carers)
intention-to-treat analysis. This method was considered appropriate to estimate the effect of assignment to intervention.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support:
245 participants randomized; 231 participants analyzed.

5% population recruited had missing data but the reasons are justified.-9 withdrew consent in favipiravir group + one randomised by error; 4 withdrew consent

Not likely that missingness depended on the true value of the outcome
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo:
Method of measuring the outcome probably appropriate.
Measurement or ascertainment of outcome probably does not differ between groups.
Blinded study (outcome assessor).
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Low risk

The protocol, statistical analysis plan, and registry were available.
Results were probably not selected from multiple outcome measurements or analyses of the data.
The trial was analyzed as pre-specified

blinded study outcome couldn't have been affected by knowledge of the intervention received.

Analysis.name: Need for admission to hospital (if ambulatory) – fixed-effect model
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Randomisation was performed at the Alfred Hospital
Clinical Trials Pharmacy using computer generated
block-randomisation lists with a block size of 6 and a 1:1
allocation ratio of favipiravir to placebo. Randomisation
was stratified by study site. 

All participants enrolled in
the community were considered as a single study site
 Not hospitalised with resumption of normal activities, n (%)-29 (29.3%) vs 37 (37.4%)
Not hospitalised, but unable to resume normal activities, n (%)-70 (70.7%) 61 (61.6%)
Geometric mean viral load in copies/mL (95% CI) 537396 (323236, 893448) 700166 (332745, 1473299)# 424121 (208564, 862464)^ since primary outcome is log reduction from baseline that wouldnot contribute to bias
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk

Quadruple blinding (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

analysis used was an intention-to-treat analysis. This method was considered appropriate to estimate the effect of assignment to intervention.

''All participants who consented and were randomised
made up the intent-to-treat (ITT) population. The modified
intent-to-treat (mITT) consisted of all participants
who received at least one dose of study drug and had a
SARS-CoV-2 nasopharyngeal PCR. The per protocol
(PP) population consisted of all mITT participants who
adhered to study procedures including receipt of study
drug for 14 days. Comparisons were made using a chisquared
test for categorical outcomes. Time to virological
cure and other time-to event outcomes (resolution of
clinical symptoms, progression to hospitalisation) were
compared between the favipiravir and placebo arms
with the log-rank test using a Kaplan-Meier time to
event analysis''
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support:
200 participants randomized; at least 190 participants analyzed

Data available for nearly all participants randomized.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo:
Method of measuring the outcome probably appropriate.
Measurement or ascertainment of outcome probably does not differ between groups.
Blinded study (outcome assessor).

''All participants who consented and were randomised
made up the intent-to-treat (ITT) population. The modified
intent-to-treat (mITT) consisted of all participants
who received at least one dose of study drug and had a
SARS-CoV-2 nasopharyngeal PCR. The per protocol
(PP) population consisted of all mITT participants who
adhered to study procedures including receipt of study
drug for 14 days. Comparisons were made using a chisquared
test for categorical outcomes''
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Low risk

The protocol, statistical analysis plan, and registry were available (dated June 24, 2020).

data analysed based on pre-specified analysis plan

Analysis.name: Need for admission to hospital (if ambulatory) – fixed-effect model
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

randomized at a 1:1 ratio into two groups of control and intervention (simple randomization using a random numbers table). Random concealment is also performed using sequentially numbered sealed opaque envelopes.

Allocation sequence probably random and concealed.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk

Open label RCT

No deviations noted from the intended intervention that arose because of the trial context. The hopitalised patients were also followed up. There was no mention about the discontinuation of the favipiravir among the hospitalised patients.

appropriate analysis used -The ITT analysis was used
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Only the data of 2 Patients in the control and 1 patient in the intervention group is missing (3%) and hence it could be concluded that data for this outcome  is available for all, or nearly all, participants randomized
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Hospitalisation is the outcome, which is a hard outcome and could not have been influenced by knowledge of the intervention
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Low risk

protocol available-analysed in accordance with a pre-specified analysis plan -IRCT20211004052664N1

No multiple eligible outcome measurements were used to assess the outcome- clinical symptoms and hospitalisation was the outcome in the protocol and is presented in the main article

Randomised patients were used for outcome analysis.
